messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Perfect SAT
messages.msgSnippet: No, because back when we discussed all this a few months ago, I e-mailed them to get answers straight from the horses mouth so to speak.  They share the same
messages.messageBody:
No, because back when we discussed all this a few months ago, I e-mailed
them to get answers "straight from the horses mouth" so to speak. They
share the same e-mail addy and they both responded to the questions.

I just think it is another case of "do as I say, not as I do," we are the
selected few and we make the rules sorta thing that I've seen quite
frequently in quite a few of the 3Rs.

Lynda

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Perfect SAT
messages.messageBody:
<< He went on about what a moral person he is, blah,
blah, blah and then proceeded to lie to O'Reilly about why they were
homeless >>

What are the odds the mother lied to him about it though?
If he's a Bob Jones moralist, maybe there's some honor-thy-mother loyalty
that's more important than the country and more important than (or tied up
in) religion.


Sandra

"Everything counts."
http://expage.com/SandraDoddArticles
http://expage.com/SandraDodd

messages.subject: Perfect SAT
messages.msgSnippet: Does everyone remember the young man who got the perfect SAT scores.  Big deal was made because they were homeless??? Well, he was on the O Reilly Factor this
messages.messageBody:
Does everyone remember the young man who got the perfect SAT scores. Big
deal was made because they were homeless???

Well, he was on the O'Reilly Factor this evening. O'Reilly asked a couple
of times about his "dropping out of school" before the young man corrected
him.

Wellll, I was really surprised at O'Reilly who usually does his homework and
is quick to pick up on things but he sure missed on this interview. The kid
rambled on and on about religion, Bob Jones University AND how his religion
comes before his country. He went on about what a moral person he is, blah,
blah, blah and then proceeded to lie to O'Reilly about why they were
homeless while implying that his mother had quit her job and hadn't gotten
another one because she wanted to be home with the kids. O'Reilly asked a
couple of times about the homeless thing and mother getting a job and the
kid kept up with the she wanted to be home with the kids.

Lynda
